Quickstart

Published

February 21, 2024

The easiest way to get started with ValidMind is to try out our Developer Framework in Jupyter Hub and to explore the ValidMind Platform UI online.

Before you begin

To try out ValidMind, you need to be a registered user on the ValidMind Platform.

Need an account for ValidMind?

Signing up is FREE — Create your account.

ValidMind Developer Framework

To try the ValidMind Developer Framework, you need access to ONE of the following:

  • Jupyter Hub (recommended)
  • Google Colaboratory (Colab)
  • Docker Desktop

To run our sample Jupyter notebooks locally, your developer environment must support Python ≧3.8 and <3.11.

ValidMind Platform UI

We support most modern browsers, such as Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, Apple Safari, or Mozilla Firefox.

To upload from the Developer Framework to the ValidMind Platform and to access the web user interface, you must be able to access our domains:

  • validmind.ai
  • validmind.com

If necessary, ask a network administrator to add these domains to your firewall allowlist (whitelist).

If your company has strict security requirements and requires you to connect via VPN or AWS PrivateLink, please contact your IT/InfoSec team. For additional help setting up a VPN or PrivateLink with ValidMind’s MRM platform please visit configure AWS PrivateLink or send an email to support@validmind.ai.

Steps

  1. Try the Developer Framework (10 minutes)

    Try our introductory Jupyter notebook to see the Developer Framework in action.

  2. Explore the Platform UI (15 minutes):

    • Explore an Example Documentation Project
    • Create Your First Documentation Project
    • Upload to Your Documentation Project

What’s next

If you’re ready to do more with ValidMind, check out Next steps.
